questionContent.questionText:
1. ante- [before/forward]

2. ab- [away from]

3. ana- [up/apart]

4. anti- [against]

5. a-, an- [no/not/without]

6. ad- [toward]

7. auto- [self/own]

8. cata- [down]

9. brady- [slow]

10. contra- [against/opposite]

11. bi- [two]

12. con- [together/with]

instructions.instructions: Give the meanings of the following preﬁxes.

readingPart.reading:
adductoranteflexionbilateral
adrenalantepartumbradycardia
analysisantisepsiscongenital anomaly
anoxiaapneacontralateral

questionContent.questionText:
1. bending forward [anteﬂexion]

2. muscle that carries the limb toward the body [adductor]

3. before birth [antepartum]

4. slow heartbeat [bradycardia]

5. gland located near (above) each kidney [adrenal]

6. absence of breathing [apnea]

7. pertaining to the opposite side [contralateral]

8. against infection [antisepsis]

9. to separate [analysis]

10. pertaining to two (both) sides [bilateral]

11. condition of no oxygen in tissues [anoxia]

12. irregularity present at birth [congenital anomaly ]

instructions.instructions: Match the listed terms with the meanings that follow.

readingPart.reading:
anabolismantigencatabolism
antibioticantitoxincongenital anomaly
antibodyautoimmune diseasecontraindication

questionContent.questionText:
1. chemical substance, such as erythromycin (-mycin  =  mold), made from molds and used against bacterial life [antibiotic]

2. process of burning food (breaking it down) and releasing the energy stored in the food [catabolism]

3. reason that a doctor would advise against taking a specific medication [contraindication]

4. disorder in which the body’s  own leukocytes make antibodies that damage its own good tissue [autoimmune disease]

5. a foreign agent (virus or bacterium) that causes production of antibodies [antigen]

6. an antibody that acts against poisons that enter the body [antitoxin]

7. process of building up proteins in cells by putting together small pieces of proteins called amino acids [anabolism]

8. protein made by lymphocytes in response to the presence in the blood of a specific antigen [antibody ]

instructions.instructions: Select from the listed terms to match the descriptions that follow.

questionContent.questionText:
1. ec-  [out/outside]

2. dys- [abnormal/bad/difficult/painful]

3. de- [down/lack of]

4. dia- [through/complete]

5. hemi- [half]

6. hypo- [deficient/under]

7. epi- [upon/on/above]

8. hyper- [excessive/above/beyond]

9. endo- [in/within] 

10. eu- [good/well]

11. in- [in/not]

12. inter- [between]

13. intra- [within]

14. infra- [below/inferior]

15. macro- [large]

16. micro- [small]

instructions.instructions: Give the meanings of the following preﬁxes.

questionContent.questionText:
1. normal thyroid function: [eu]thyroid

2. painful breathing: [dys]pnea

3. pregnancy that is out of place (outside the uterus): [ec]topic

4. instrument to visually examine within the body: endo[scope]

5. removal of half of the tongue: [hemi]glossectomy

6. good (exaggerated) feeling (of well-being): [eu]phoria

7. pertaining to within the windpipe: endo[tracheal]

8. blood condition of less than normal sugar: [hypo]glycemia

9. condition (congenital anomaly) of large head: [macro]cephaly

10. pertaining to between the ribs: [inter]costal

11. pertaining to within a vein: intra[venous]

12. condition of abnormal formation (of cells): dys[plasia]

13. condition of excessive formation (numbers of cells): [hyper]plasia

14. structure (membrane) that forms the inner lining of the heart: endo[cardium]

15. pertaining to below the ribs: infra[costal]

16. blood condition of excessive amount of sugar: hyper[glycemia]

17. A group of congenital disorders involving abnormal development of muscle mass and strength is: muscular [dystrophy]

18. Zika virus infection during pregnancy can be a cause of decreased development of an infant’s head and brain [micro]cephaly

instructions.instructions: Complete the following terms, based on their meanings as given.

readingPart.reading:
dehydrationincisionmetamorphosis
dialysisinsomniametastasis
diarrheamalaisemicroscope
exophthalmos (proptosis)malignantpancytopenia

questionContent.questionText:
1. vague feeling of bodily discomfort [malaise]

2. inability to sleep [insomnia]

3. lack of water [dehydration]

4. spread of a cancerous tumor to a secondary organ or tissue [metastasis]

5. instrument used to view small objects [microscope]

6. a cut into an organ or tissue [incision]

7. outward bulging of the eyeballs [exophthalmos]

8. condition of change in shape or form [metamorphosis]

9. watery discharge of wastes from the colon [diarrhea]

10. deﬁciency of all (blood) cells [pancytopenia]

11. separation of wastes from the blood by using a machine that does the job of the kidney [dialysis]

12. harmful, cancerous [malignant ]

instructions.instructions: Match the listed terms with the meanings that follow.

questionContent.questionText:
1. mal- [bad]

2. pan- [all]

3. per- [through]

4. meta- [change/beyond]

5. para- [near/beside/abnormal]

6. peri- [surrounding]

7. poly- [many/much]

8. post- [after/behind]

9. pro- [before/forward]

10. pre- [before/in front of]

11. sub- [under]

12. supra- [above]

13. re- [back/again]

14. retro- [behind/backward]

15. tachy- [fast]

16. syn- [together/with]

17. uni- [one]

18. trans- [across/through]

19. neo- [new]

20. epi- [above/upon/on]

instructions.instructions: Give the meanings of the following preﬁxes.

questionContent.questionText:
1. membrane surrounding the heart: [peri/per/poly/pros]cardium
2. pertaining to through the skin: [per/peri/poly/pros]cutaneous
3. pertaining to behind the peritoneum: [retro/supra/trans/sub]peritoneal
4. above the pubic bone: [supra/retro/trans/sub]pubic
5. inflammation of many nerves: [poly/peri/per/pros]neuritis
6. bending backward: [retro/supra/trans/sub]flexion
7. pertaining to through the urethra: [trans/retro/supra/sub]urethral
8. pertaining to below the skin: [sub/retro/supra/trans]cutaneous
9. rapid, fast breathing: [tachy/bi/sub/retro/poly]pnea
10. pertaining to one side: [uni/poly/sub/trans]lateral
11. artificial limb or part of the body: [pros/peri/per/poly]thesis
12. both sides: [bi/tachy/sub/retro/poly]lateral
13. subjective change of condition as observed by a patient: [sym/sub/syn]ptom
14. group of objective findings that characterize an abnormal condition: [syn/sub/sym]drome

instructions.instructions: From the dropdown, select the prefix that best completes the described term.

readingPart.reading:
adrenalprodromeremission
neoplasmprolapsesyndactyly
paralysisrecombinant DNAsyndrome
parathyroidrelapseultrasonography

questionContent.questionText:
1. return of a disease or its symptoms [relapse]

2. loss of movement in muscles [paralysis]

3. congenital anomaly in which ﬁngers or toes are webbed (formed together) [syndactyly]

4. four endocrine glands that are located near (behind) another endocrine gland in the neck [parathyroid]

5. glands that are located above the kidneys [adrenal]

6. symptoms that come before the actual illness [prodrome]

7. technique of transferring genetic material from one organism into another [recombinant DNA]

8. sliding, sagging downward or forward [prolapse]

9. new growth or tumor [neoplasm]

10. process of using sound waves to create an image of organs and structures in the body [ultrasonography]

11. group of signs and symptoms that occur together and indicate a particular disorder [syndrome]

12. symptoms lessen and a patient feels better [remission ]

instructions.instructions: Match the listed terms with the meanings that follow.

questionContent.questionText:
1. pertaining to new birth: neo[natal]

2. after death: post[mortem]

3. spread of a cancerous tumor: meta[stasis]

4. branching into two: bi[furcation]

5. increase in development (size of cells): hyper[trophy]

6. pertaining to a chemical that works against bacterial life: [anti]biotic

7. hand bones (beyond the wrist): [meta]carpals

8. protein produced by leukocytes to ﬁght foreign organisms: anti[body]

9. group of symptoms that occur together: [syn]drome

10. surface or skin tissue of the body: [epi]thelium

instructions.instructions: Complete the following terms, based on their meanings as given.

questionContent.questionText:
1. Dr. Tate felt that Mrs. Snow’s condition of thrombocytopenia was a clear [contraindication/analysis/synthesis] to performing elective surgery.

2. Medical science was revolutionized by the introduction of [antibiotics/antigens/antibodies] in the 1940s. Now some infections can be treated with only one dose.

3. Robert's 82-year-old grandfather complained of [insomnia/malaise/dialysis] despite taking the sleeping medication that his doctor prescribed.

4. During her pregnancy, Ms. Payne described pressure on her [pubic symphysis/pituitary gland/parathyroid gland] making it difficult for her to find a comfortable position, even when seated.

5. Many times, people with diabetes accidentally take too much insulin. This results in lowering their blood sugar so much that they may be admitted to the emergency department with [hypoglycemia/hyperplasia/hyperglycemia].

6. Before his migraine headaches began, John noticed changes in his eyesight, such as bright spots, zigzag lines, and double vision. His physician told him that these were [prodromal/symbiotic/exophthalmic] symptoms.

7. After hiking in the Grand Canyon without an adequate water supply, Julie experienced [dehydration/hyperglycemia/hypothyroidism]

8. At 65 years of age, Paul Smith often felt fullness in his urinary bladder but had difficulty urinating. He visited his [urologist/cardiologist/nephrologist],  who examined his prostate gland and diagnosed [hyperplasia/atrophy/ischemia].  The doctor advised  [transurethral/intracostal/peritoneal] resection of Paul’s prostate.

9. After running the Boston Marathon, Elizabeth felt nauseated and dizzy. She realized that she was experiencing [hypoglycemia/malaise/euphoria] and drank a sports drink containing sugar, which made her feel better.

10. While she was taking an antibiotic that reacted with sunlight, Ruth’s  physician advised her that sunbathing was  [contraindicated/unilateral/contralateral] and might cause a serious sunburn.

11. Puerperal (pertaining to childbirth) fever was an iatrogenic infection; it was carried from one woman to another by the doctor before the days of [antisepsis/antigens/antibodies].

12. Dysplastic nevi (abnormal pigmented lesions or moles) on a patient's skin may be a [precancerous/metastatic/unilateral] sign of malignant skin cancer called melanoma.

13. Nerve cells of the brain may [atrophy/relapse/hypertrophy] in old age because of ischemia caused by restricted blood ﬂow.

14. Changes in cell growth resulting in cells that differ in size, shape, and appearance are the result of chronic inflammation and irritation. When the condition occurs in the uterine cervix, it is known as cervical [dysplasia/prolapse/paralysis].

instructions.instructions: Select the correct term from the dropdown to complete the following sentences.
